titleInfo.title: USA v. Mueller
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 14 Motion to Continue Deadline for Filing Pretrial Motions as to Rock Mueller (1). The defendant shall file any pretrial motions in the above captioned matter no later than the 10th day of April, 2006. This Court furtherfinds that, based upon the showing set forth in defendant's Motion, the ends of justice will be served by extending the deadline for filing pretrial motions. Further, that taking such action outweighs the best interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial. Accordingly, the time from March 10, 2006, until April 10, 2006, shall be excluded from any speedy trial calculation. Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 3/10/2006. (JAR)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 14 Motion to Continue Deadline for Filing Pretrial Motions as to Rock Mueller (1). The defendant shall file any pretrial motions in the above captioned matter no later than the 10th day of April, 2006. This Court furtherfinds that, based upon the showing set forth in defendant's Motion, the ends of justice will be served by extending the deadline for filing pretrial motions. Further, that taking such action outweighs the best interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial. Accordingly, the time from March 10, 2006, until April 10, 2006, shall be excluded from any speedy trial calculation. Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 3/10/2006. (JAR)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mueller
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting defendant's 17 Motion to Extend Deadline to File Pretrial Motions as to Rock Mueller (1). The defendant shall file any pretrial motions in the above captioned matter no later than the 8th day of May, 2006. This Court further finds that, based upon the showing set forth in defendant's Motion, the ends of justice will be served by extending the deadline for filing pretrial motions. Further, that taking such action outweighs the best interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial. Accordingly, the time from April 10, 2006, until May 8, 2006, shall be excluded from any speedy trial calculation pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 3161(h)(8)(A). Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 4/10/2006. (CS, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting defendant's 17 Motion to Extend Deadline to File Pretrial Motions as to Rock Mueller (1). Further, that taking such action outweighs the best interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial. titleInfo.title: USA v. Mueller
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting in part 22 Motion to Continue Trial as to Rock Mueller (1). The defendant's trial in the above captioned matter shall be continued to the 16th day of October, 2006, at 9:00 a.m. This Court further finds that, based upon the showing set forth in defendant's Motion, the ends of justice will be served by continuing defendant's trial. Further, that taking such action outweighs the best interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial. Accordingly, the time from August 31, 2006, until the time this case is re-scheduled for trial shall be excluded from any speedy trial calculation pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 3161(h)(8)(A). Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(CS, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting in part 22 Motion to Continue Trial as to Rock Mueller (1). The defendant's trial in the above captioned matter shall be continued to the 16th day of October, 2006, at 9:00 a.m. This Court further finds that, based upon the showing set forth in defendant's Motion, the ends of justice will be served by continuing defendant's trial. Further, that taking such action outweighs the best interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial. Accordingly, the time from August 31, 2006, until the time this case is re-scheduled for trial shall be excluded from any speedy trial calculation pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 3161(h)(8)(A). Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(CS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mueller
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to Rock Mueller. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's Motion to Continue the Deadline for Filing Objections to the Revised Presentence Investigation Report, Downward Departure Motion and supporting brief 31 is granted; (2) The defendant shall file any Objections to the RPSR and Downward Departure Motion with supporting brief no later than 1/11/2007. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to Rock Mueller. titleInfo.title: USA v. Mueller
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report and Addendum as to defendant Rock Mueller. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's objection to criminal history points 33 will be resolved at sentencing. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects.ETC.Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report and Addendum as to defendant Rock Mueller. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's objection to criminal history points 33 will be resolved at sentencing. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects.ETC.Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mueller
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to defendant Rock Mueller (1). Upon guilty plea to Count 1 of the Indictment, the defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of forty-one (41) months to run concurrent with sentence imposed in Case Number CR04-473 in the District Court of Lancaster County, Nebraska. Three (3) years of Supervised Release to follow and defendant is ordered to pay a Special Assessment of $100.00. Counts 2, 3, are DISMISSED on motion of the government as to this defendant only. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 CC to USM)(JAR)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to defendant Rock Mueller (1). Upon guilty plea to Count 1 of the Indictment, the defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of forty-one (41) months to run concurrent with sentence imposed in Case Number CR04-473 in the District Court of Lancaster County, Nebraska. Three (3) years of Supervised Release to follow and defendant is ordered to pay a Special Assessment of $100.00. Counts 2, 3, are DISMISSED on motion of the government as to this defendant only. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 CC to USM)(JAR)
